intro: Castratella piloselloides, commonly known as the hairy sandwort, is a low-growing, flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is characterized by its small, green, succulent leaves and clusters of tiny, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically thrives in dry, sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is adapted to withstand drought conditions due to its succulent leaves and shallow root system. Castratella piloselloides is often used in xeriscaping and is valued for its ornamental appeal in rock gardens.
